entry.title: The Local Authorities (Capital Finance and Accounting) (England) (Amendment) (No.3) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Capital Finance and Accounting) (England) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”) by amending the definition of “affordable housing” and substituting the names of the authorities and the values of Column A (assumed debt for each quarter) in the Table in the Schedule to the 2003 Regulations with names of the authorities and the values set out in the Schedule to these Regulations.

entry.title: The Penalty Charges (Prescribed Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend The Penalty Charges (Prescribed Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 by increasing the penalty charges for road traffic offences subject to civil enforcement from £60.00 to £90.00.

entry.title: The Prosecution of Offences (Custody Time Limits) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the provisions of the Prosecution of Offences (Custody Time Limits) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/299) (“the 1987 Regulations”) relating to custody time limits where someone is sent for trial under section 51 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (c. 37) (“the 1998 Act”). These amendments are in consequence of the coming into force in certain areas of Schedule 3 to the Criminal Justice Act 2003 (c. 44) (“the 2003 Act”). Schedule 3, in particular, amends the 1998 Act to expand the circumstances in which a person is to be sent by a magistrates' court to the Crown Court for trial for an offence. The 1987 Regulations are amended so that they apply where a person is sent for trial under the 1998 Act, whether under the 1998 Act as amended by Schedule 3 to the 2003 Act or not.

entry.title: The M54 Motorway (Junction 2 Improvements i54 Strategic Employment Area) (Connecting Roads) Scheme 2012
entry.summary: This order authorises the Secretary of State to construct new slip roads west of Junction 2 of the M54. The new slip roads will connect the eastbound and westbound carriageways of the motorway with new roundabouts, to be constructed as part of the access and egress arrangements for the i54 Strategic Employment Area under the provisions of The M54 Motorway (Junction 2 Improvements i54 Strategic Employment Area) (Trunk Roads) Order 2012.

entry.title: The Licensed Legal Services (Maximum Penalty and Interest in respect of Approved Regulators) (Scotland) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of Part 2 of the Legal Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Community Right to Challenge (Expressions of Interest and Excluded Services) (England) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under powers contained in Chapter 2 of Part 5 of the Localism Act 2011, which sets out a right whereby certain bodies may submit an expression of interest in providing or assisting in providing services on behalf of specified authorities in the exercise of any of those authorities’ functions in relation to England.

entry.title: The Property Factors (Scotland) Act 2011 (Commencement No. 2 and Transitional) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 1stJuly 2012, Part1 of the Property Factors (Scotland) Act 2011 (“the Act”) on the registration of property factors, insofar as it is not already in force, except for sections1(2) (making the register public) and 12 (offence of operating as a property factor without registration). It also brings into force on that day section 16 of the Act (dispute resolution) which provides for the homeowner housing panel and committees.

entry.title: The Licensed Legal Services (Interests in Licensed Providers) (Scotland) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations make further provision relating to interests in licensed legal services providers for the purposes of Part 2 of the Legal Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Private Landlord Registration (Information and Fees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Private Landlord Registration (Information and Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2005, which prescribe the information that a person must provide, and make provision for the fees that a person must pay, in relation to landlord registration.

entry.title: The M54 Motorway (Junction 2 Improvements i54 Strategic Employment Area) (Trunk Roads) Order 2012
entry.summary: This order authorises the Secretary of State to provide a new main road forming the access to and egress from the i54 Strategic Employment Area from and to Junction 2 of the M54. The new road, which will be known as the A449 Link Road, replaces the existing slip roads leading from and to the eastbound and westbound carriageways of the M54 which will be stopped up under the provisions of The M54 Motorway (Junction 2 Improvements i54 Strategic Employment Area) (Side Roads) Order 2012.

entry.title: The Statistics and Registration Service Act 2007 (Disclosure of Social Security and Revenue Information) Regulations 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Statistics and Registration Service Act 2007 (Disclosure of Social Security and Revenue Information) Regulations 2012

entry.summary: These Regulations provide that the Secretary of State may disclose to the Statistics Board information in respect of individuals in connection with certain benefit payments received on or after 1st January 2001. The Secretary of State may also disclose information received on or after 1st January 2001 in respect of individuals who have received assistance to gain employment.

entry.title: The Licensed Legal Services (Complaints and Compensation Arrangements) (Scotland) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations make further provision in respect of licensed legal services.

entry.title: The Private Rented Housing (Scotland) Act 2011 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings sections 1 and 4(a) of the Private Rented Housing (Scotland) Act 2011 (“the 2011 Act”) into force on 1stJuly 2012.

entry.title: The Criminal Defence Service (Funding) (Amendment No. 2) Order 2012

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order amends the Criminal Defence Service (Funding) Order 2007 (S.I. 2007/1174).

entry.title: The Legal Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement No. 2 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force the provisions of Part 2 of, and schedules 1 to 8 to, the Legal Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the Act”) in so far as these are not already in force. It also brings into force certain provisions of Part 4 of the Act which are connected with Part 2. The day appointed for the commencement of these provisions is 2nd July 2012.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Commencement No. 28 and Saving Provisions) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Criminal Justice Act 2003 (c. 44) (“the 2003 Act”).

entry.title: The Health and Social Care Act 2012 (Commencement No.1 and Transitory Provision) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Health and Social Care Act 2012 (c.7) (“the Act”). It is the first such Order to be made under the Act.

entry.title: The Misuse of Drugs (Designation) (Amendment No.2) (England, Wales and Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: Section 7(3) of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 requires regulations to be made to allow the use for medical purposes of the drugs which are subject to control under that Act. Section 7(3) does not apply to any drug designated by order under section 7(4) as a drug to which section 7(4) is to apply. This Order amends the Misuse of Drugs (Designation) Order 2001 by inserting into Part 1 of the Schedule to that Order desoxypipradrol and other pipradrol‑related compounds.

entry.title: The Burma/Myanmar (Financial Restrictions) (Suspension) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: Council Regulation (EC) No. 194/2008 (“the Council Regulation”) of 25 February 2008 renewing and strengthening the restrictive measures in respect of Burma/Myanmar and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 817/2006 (O.J. L 66, 10.3.2008, p.1) contains various sanctions measures imposed in respect of Burma/Myanmar. Those measures include financial sanctions which require the funds and economic resources of certain persons, entities and bodies to be frozen and which impose restrictions on the financing of certain enterprises. Parts 3 and 5 of the Burma/Myanmar (Financial Restrictions) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”) provide for criminal penalties for breach of the financial sanctions provisions of the Council Regulation.

entry.title: The Fire and Rescue Services (Framework) (Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: Section40 of the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005 (“the Act”) requires the Scottish Ministers to prepare a document, which must set out priorities and objectives for relevant authorities in connection with the carrying out of their functions and containing related guidance and such other matters relating to those authorities or those functions as the Scottish Ministers consider appropriate. Under section41(1) of the Act, relevant authorities must have regard to the document in carrying out their functions. Section40(4) of the Act provides that the document has effect only when brought into effect by the Scottish Ministers by order. For this purpose, article2 of this Order gives effect to the document prepared by the Scottish Ministers entitled Transitional Fire and Rescue Framework for Scotland 2012 which was published in June 2012. The document is available on the Scottish Government website: www.scotland.gov.uk/transitionalfireandrescueframework.
